children.text: There is a gap in the return air void where it has not been properly sealed, which will allow cold air from the cavities of this home to be drawn into the heating unit, greatly reducing the efficiency of the unit, while greatly increasing the running costs.
Part 3.12.5.3 Heating and cooling ductwork of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that
‘Heating and cooling ductwork and fittings must be sealed against air loss’ .
The return air must be properly sealed from top to bottom to ensure that only returned air is drawn into the heating system.
